name: proscribing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
proscribe
(of a government or other authority) to not allow something: Torture and summary execution of political prisoners are proscribed by international law. The Athletics Federation has banned the runner from future races for using proscribed drugs. Synonyms
disallow
forbid
outlaw
prohibit
veto
